title: Capacitor - V-d graph with or without dielectric

content.question: A student creates two different parallel plate capacitors in the lab. Both of the capacitors are made with aluminum foil as the plates, but one of the capacitors has paper in between the plates and one has air in between the plates. While varying the plate separation <math alttext="d" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>d</mi></math>, by pulling the plates apart with insulating handles and making sure that the gap between the plates of the capacitor with paper is completely filled with paper, the student measures the potential difference between the plates. Which of the following correctly identifies which of the capacitors <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> has paper between the plates, and which has air?

choices.label: <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is the one with air and <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is the one with paper.

<math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is the one with paper and <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is the one with the air.
Impossible to tell without knowing the charge.
This graph could not give the answer, even if the charge was known.

content.answer: <math alttext="C sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is the one with air and <math alttext="C sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>C</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> is the one with paper.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
